admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific
subsc: Other social services,General public administration sector,Micro- and SME finance,General industry and trade sector
trustfund:
TF021191-ASEM - CHINA-SOCIAL ASPECTS OF
            CORPORATE RESTRUCTURING,TF039703-CHINA - ENTERPRISE REFORM,TF039136-CHINA - ENTERPRISE REFORM
            DIAGNOSTICS METHODS

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Enterprise Reform
            Project is to learn from innovative methods for the reform
            of China's state-owned enterprise sector. Its
            development objectives are to identify and adapt potential
            improvements in enterprise reform methods to local
            circumstances, test their feasibility through pilot
            implementation, and make these lessons widely known among
            local and central policy-makers. Components of the projects
            consist of a) restructuring models for large and medium
            enterprises; b) management development; c) retraining and
            reemployment of "laid off" state-owned enterprise
            employees; and d) development of private small and medium
            enterprises. Each component will be implemented in the
            following areas: Changsha, Shenyang, Wuhan, and Wuhu.
